p: The uniform spreading ability of the coating on the targeted product is a very important effectiveness indicator of an edible coating. Therefore, researchers checked the surface free energy of the food products, the surface tension of the edible coatings, and spreading coefficient (W s) while designing their coating formulations. Senturk Parreidt, Schott, Schmid, and Müller [ 88] characterized the alginate-based coating formulations with various concentrations and types of surfactants (0–5% tween 40, tween 80, span 80, span 60, and soy lecithin).
